com.google.android.exoplayer.drm

Interface DrmSessionManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StreamingDrmSessionManager

    public interface DrmSessionManager
    Manages a DRM session.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int STATE_CLOSED
      The session is closed.
      static int STATE_ERROR
      The error state.
      static int STATE_OPENED
      The session is open, but does not yet have the keys required for decryption.
      static int STATE_OPENED_WITH_KEYS
      The session is open and has the keys required for decryption.
      static int STATE_OPENING
      The session is being opened (i.e.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the session.
      java.lang.Exception getError()
      Gets the cause of the error state.
      MediaCrypto getMediaCrypto()
      Gets a MediaCrypto for the open session.
      int getState()
      Gets the current state of the session.
      void open(java.util.Map<java.util.UUID,byte[]> drmInitData, java.lang.String mimeType)
      Opens the session, possibly asynchronously.
      boolean requiresSecureDecoderComponent(java.lang.String mimeType)
      Whether the session requires a secure decoder for the specified mime type.

    • Field Detail

      • STATE_ERROR

        static final int STATE_ERROR
        The error state. getError() can be used to retrieve the cause.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_CLOSED

        static final int STATE_CLOSED
        The session is closed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_OPENING

        static final int STATE_OPENING
        The session is being opened (i.e. open(Map, String) has been called, but the session is not yet open).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_OPENED

        static final int STATE_OPENED
        The session is open, but does not yet have the keys required for decryption.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_OPENED_WITH_KEYS

        static final int STATE_OPENED_WITH_KEYS
        The session is open and has the keys required for decryption.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • open

        void open(java.util.Map<java.util.UUID,byte[]> drmInitData,
        java.lang.String mimeType)
        Opens the session, possibly asynchronously.
        Parameters:
        drmInitData - Initialization data for the drm schemes supported by the media, keyed by scheme UUID.
        mimeType - The mimeType of the media.

      • close

        void close()
        Closes the session.

      • getState

        int getState()
        Gets the current state of the session.
        Returns:
        One of STATE_ERROR, STATE_CLOSED, STATE_OPENING, STATE_OPENED and STATE_OPENED_WITH_KEYS.

      • getMediaCrypto

        MediaCrypto getMediaCrypto()
        Gets a MediaCrypto for the open session.

        This method may be called when the manager is in the following states: STATE_OPENED, STATE_OPENED_WITH_KEYS

        Returns:
        A MediaCrypto for the open session.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If called when a session isn't opened.

      • requiresSecureDecoderComponent

        boolean requiresSecureDecoderComponent(java.lang.String mimeType)
        Whether the session requires a secure decoder for the specified mime type.

        Normally this method should return MediaCrypto#requiresSecureDecoderComponent(String), however in some cases implementations may wish to modify the return value (i.e. to force a secure decoder even when one is not required).

        This method may be called when the manager is in the following states: STATE_OPENED, STATE_OPENED_WITH_KEYS

        Returns:
        Whether the open session requires a secure decoder for the specified mime type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If called when a session isn't opened.

      • getError

        java.lang.Exception getError()
        Gets the cause of the error state.

        This method may be called when the manager is in any state.

        Returns:
        An exception if the state is STATE_ERROR. Null otherwise.
